intro: Cynoglossum californicum, commonly known as California mouse ear, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and violet or blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It has a low-growing habit and often forms dense mats. Cynoglossum californicum is adapted to coastal and inland regions with a Mediterranean climate.
